description: personal study ID composed by the first authors’ first surname_year of publication_first title word
number of experiment from publication
name of data subset – can include different experiments within data set/ different training conditions/ pre-test data/ etc
name of the participant
sex of the participant
species of individuals participating in the study - chimpanzee
set of trials per participant – 1 is for the session for each participant increased by 1 with every session
presentation of the experiment to the participants - usually numerical
species subgroup at time of data collection – WKPRC chimpanzee group a or b/ etc
overall number of the session – 1 refers to the every first day of the experiments increased by 1 with every day
number of the session for the species increased by 1 with every session
order of the participant within a day – e.g. 5 means 4 participants were tested on the day before the participant
social / non-social
whether the food was delivered to the booth by experimenter or chimp (participant)
refers to the total number of trials presented per session
type of food presented to the participant with an apparatus that delivered food if a rope was pulled
time in seconds the food was placed in front of the participant (but not accessible) – 7 /15
whether the stooge(conspecific) is present inside the booth (1) or the booth is empty(0)
whether the door between two booths was open(1) or closed (0)
whether the participant reached through the whole and touched the rope
whether the participant made an attempt to pull the rope
whether the participant pulled the rope
overall number of sessions with stooge- increasing by 1 with every session
